RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Special Weight Purse 31800. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STAGE NAME dueled early, shook clear on the turn, widened in the stretch under strong handling to win as much the best. RAY'S EMPIRE chased the winner, was no match late but was second best. JOSH'N pressed the pace on the inside and had no rally. MAN'S CHOICE settled early, saved ground and had no rally. SHOWTIME BOY pressed the early pace and was through after a half. LEWIS AND CLARK wide early, was outrun.

ENTRY.COMMENT: settled early, saved ground and had no rally,

RACE.FOOTNOTES: RECIPROCAL dueled early, shook clear on the turn, widened in the stretch under mild urging to win as much the best. FULL TIME STRUTIN was no factor. BLUE AGAVE had brief foot and stopped.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 36200. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowance s).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD N SILVER was away alertly and quickly made the lead, was nicely rated on the front end, led throughout and widened late under firm handling. GONE IN A FLASH raced mid pack early, rallied on the far turn three wide, was no match late for the winner but was second best. LUCKY STREAK chased the winner throughout and weakened late. JEBIP saved ground early, angled out down the backside and was no menace late. DERBY INCLUDED allowed to settle, failed to menace. RUMBLE STRIP RON had good position early and faltered in the lane. LIL RICKYS JEWEL pressed the early pace and was through after a half.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 92. Claiming Purse 15400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Prefer red).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMASH dueled early, shook clear down the backside, repulsed a bid at the quarter pole, finished full of run and drew off under mild urging. SCORSESE dueled early, chased the winner down the backside, rallied at the quarter pole and drew close, was no match late but was clearly second best. ALGORIX had good position early, saved ground, and was no threat late. SAY HEY KID allowed to settle, failed to menace. DUEL FUEL tracked three wide and was no threat. CALL PAPA showed little and trailed.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: ADANO had good position on the inside, angled out three wide in the stretch, closed determinedly and was up in the final stride. FUEGO CALIENTE dueled on the lead throughout from the rail, held grudgingly after a long battle and just missed. BALTIC FLEET dueled on the lead throughout, held gamely and weakened only slightly late. POCO CHARLIE was unhurried early, improved late while no threat. AULD LANGE SYNE dueled three wide and weakened in the stretch. MONEY FOR MISCHIEF allowed to settle, failed to menace. ARTEMUS EAGLE raced mid pack and had no rally.

Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CROSSED UP was never far back, rallied at the quarter pole five wide, closed determinedly and was up in the last strides. LEXY ANNA set the early pace, was hooked at the quarter pole, drew clear again the stretch and was caught late. PROPHETESS was unhurried early, swung five wide in the stretch and rallied. SASSY POWER had good position early on the inside, angled out four wide at the quarter pole and drew close, faltered late. CONGRATS JENSEN dueled three wide and weakened in mid stretch. CITY SIGNS allowed to settle, failed to menace. SCARLETT'S AWISH dueled on the lead while between horses and gave way in the stretch..

RACE.FOOTNOTES: J. P. RACE raced between horses early, angled out three wide on the far turn, quickly drew off under mild urging to win as much the best. TONKAWA SPRINGS dueled on the lead until the top of the stretch, was no match for the winner late but was second best. SUPER BROTHER vied for the lead from the inside and gradually weakened. FORT LOWELL tracked four wide and lacked a late response. FLOCKED never far back, saved ground and had no rally. KILLER BEE was unhurried early, and was no threat. DAWN WEST raced wide early and was outrun.
